bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Alberto Recio, June 24, 1940

div1.p: Hench informs Recio that he found some interesting material about Camp Columbia at the U.S. Army Medical Museum.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Alberto Recio, June 24, 1940
div1.opener:
June 24, 1940
He gave address as
Carlos III y Montoro
Dr. Alberto Recio
Ave. de la Independencia y Montoro
Habana, Cuba
Dear Doctor Recio:
div1.p:
I have just returned from an absence of two weeks in
the East. Among other places, I visited Washington and went
through the files of the Army Medical Museum, in an attempt
to find pictures of the old Camp Columbia. I think I found
some material of great interest, and in due time will assemble
it and send copies of the material to those of you who are
interested in the work of yellow fever and of Camp Lazear.
I appreciate very much, indeed, your letter, and Dr. Alvare's
address. I am writing him today.
div1.closer: Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
